ygData.subject: Re: weapon ideas?
ygData.msgSnippet: My experience is that with my character, her stamina never fell below 50% using light weapons even in LONG fights.  Now her skill is nice and high in duel
ygData.messageBody:
My experience is that with my character, her stamina never fell below 50%
using light weapons even in LONG fights. Now her skill is nice and high in
duel wield stamina seems to go down slower during battles. I have not seen
it drop more than 2 bars, one is normal. Thats with 75 stam.

> ----------
> From: slu@...[SMTP:slu@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Saturday, May 29, 1999 5:44 AM
> To: Sean.Clark@...; warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] weapon ideas?
>
> From: <slu@...>
>
> Wish I had read this yesterday! I had the same experience in Crushbone
> last night. Having just gotten the dual wield ability I added a second
> mino axe and proceeded to "Ginsu" (good name) the Orc Legionaires &
> Oracles in the castle. Unfortunately I too ran out of stamina (I have 90+
> sta) & was unable to flee when a bunch of the critters buddies showed up.
>
>
> Needless to say I had to aplogize to my group a little for getting myself
> (& a couple of them) killed through this mistake (I mean hey aside from
> swimming I've never even *seen* my sta bar move before).
>
> Question: If the weapon is faster but lighter doesn't it still wear down
> stamina (i.e. more swings burning more juice)? Does this mean no matter
> what you equip you are still screwed for Sta?
>
> BTW: You have not truely lived until you have been made into a tent peg
> by a giant!!
>
> Flair on Fennin Ro
>
> > ** Original Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] weapon ideas?
> > ** Original Sender: Sean.Clark@...
> > ** Original Date: Wed, 26 May 1999 16:09:58 -0600
>
> > ** Original Message follows...
>
> >
> > From: Sean.Clark@...
> >
> > At level 15 I am just getting into the daul weild/double attack mode,
> but
> > Tom's info looks very appropriate. My primary reason for looking to
> switch
> > from longsword primary and mino axe secondary isn't speed or damage its
> > STAMINA. There is a current thread running on this topic - be sure you
> > check it out. Mino axes are HEAVY, and weilding two weapons already
> takes a
> > lot of stamina. Combine this with the fact that the length of your
> fights
> > increases with the level of the MOB and you run into quite a few
> situations
> > where you are runnng too low on mana.
> > Last weekend I was soloing some orcs in the south part of Oasis while I
> was
> > waiting for some friends to come so we could hunt some crocs. I engaged
> a
> > lone orc and pulled him down to the beach. While I was fighting this
> orc
> > (and doing pretty well - he was conning blue) I heard the DREADED sound
> of
> > an approaching giant (You know the sound if you've heard it! It's one of
> the
> > few things that gives me an adrenaline rush EVERY time in EQ!). Not
> wanting
> > to be squished like a bug, I tried to take myself and the orc closer to
> the
> > zone boundary - without getting into the ocean - and I got a LITTLE too
> > close to the OTHER orc that was in the camp. To make a long story short
> I
> > managed to avoid the Giant, but I couldn't flee the orcs without running
> > into the giant. I killed off the first orc and still had around half my
> > health...I ran out of stamina before I ran out of health with the second
> > orc, and I was pretty damn confused! You see I was SWINGING, but I
> wasn't
> > HITTING anything. I checked SEVERAL timesto make sure I was still in
> attack
> > mode and properly targeted (you guys know that feeling??) and then
> FINALLY
> > realized I was just plain ol' tuckered out. Anyway it came down to the
> last
> > couple of blows, and I DID die...but I learned a lesson too. Mino axes
> are
> > pretty cool (and I love the way they look - 2 axes is even cooler!), but
> > swords are much less demanding on your stamina.
> > Right now I am trying to see if I can improve my Piercing skill (I think
> its
> > around 20, lol!) by sticking a Fine Steel Rapier in my secondary weapon
> > slot. I'll let you all know how that works!
> > Thanks fer your time...sorry if I rambled!
> > Grukklukk of Bristlebane, lvl 15 basher
> >
> > -----Original Message-----From: Tom Swift [mailto:tswift@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, May 26, 1999 12:51 PM
> > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] weapon ideas?
> >
> >
> > From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
> >
> > You missed the recent discussion on that very topic.
> >
> > Keep your 2 hander for dealing with blue creatures....keep your skill
> up.
> > As far as 1hs, use the longsword in your primary slot and the mino in
> your
> > secondary. There may be a case for getting 2 swords for speed. I am not
> > sure you are getting the most out of dual wield with one fast and one
> slow
> > weapon.
> >
> > My current combo is primary: tentacle whip secondary: combine scimitar.
> My
> > friends call me Ginsu :)
> >
> >
> > -----Original Message-----From: bloodore guts <bloodore@...>
> > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> > Date: Wednesday, May 26, 1999 2:39 PM
> > Subject: [warriors_eq] weapon ideas?
> >
> >
> > >From: "bloodore guts" <bloodore@...>
> > >
> > >hey there..
> > > I just got dual weild. I am thinking of changing from a FS two-handed
> > sword to two 1H/weapons. Do you think that a magic combine long sword
> and a
> > mino axe would make a good combination? Which one should I use as a
> primary
> > weapon? Any ideas or suggestions would be helpful! Thanks in advance!
> > >
